name: Black Girls Code
description: Organization devoted to showing the world that black girls can code.

name: Bridge Troll
description: Events organized by volunteers to empower people with technology.

name: Code 2040
description: Through a variety of programs and fellowships, Code2040 is a great initiative creating opportunities in tech for Black and Latinx talent.

name: Codebar
description: Codebar is a non-profit initiative that facilitates the growth of a diverse tech community by running regular programming workshops.

name: Diversity Charter
description: Charter to show that you care about diversity.

name: Django Girls
description: Non-profit organization and a community that empowers and helps women to organize programming workshops.

name: FrameShift Consulting
description: FrameShift open sources their fantastic Ally Skills Workshop, Conference incident response materials and many other resources allowing to scale creating welcoming, inclusive, diverse cultures.

name: Fund Club
description: Fund Club raises money to numerous initiatives for mental health, diversity, inclusion, anti-harassment and more.

name: Girl Develop It
description: Nonprofit organization that exists to provide affordable and judgment-free opportunities for women interested in learning web and software development.

name: Girls Who Code
description: Organization which aims to close the gender gap in technology.

name: GoodForPoc
description: List of inclusive companies for people of color in tech.

name: Hack the Hood
description: Non-profit organization that introduces low-income youth of color to careers in tech.

name: Hidden Genius Project
description: Program to connect young black males with all they need to become high-performing entrepreneurs and technologists.

name: Kapor Center
description: The Kapor family of organizations works to remove barriers to Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM) education and tech careers for underrepresented people of color.

name: Open Sourcing Mental Illness
description: Open Sourcing Mental Illness is a non-profit corporation dedicated to raising awareness, educating, and providing resources to support mental wellness in the tech and open source communities.

name: ParadigmIQ
description: Paradigm offers a range of workshops, training and assessments aiding in diversity, inclusion, belonging, retention and more.

name: People Of Creativity
description: Organization that focuses on creating a community that shares opportunities, experiences and ideas ultimately bettering the representation of minorities throughout creative industries.

name: Ping a Programadoras
description: Group of women and people of non-binary gender whose purposes are the reflection and empowerment in the field of technology.

name: Project Include
description: Non-profit organization that uses data and advocacy to accelerate diversity and inclusion solutions in the tech industry.

name: PyLadies
description: International mentorship group with a focus on helping more women become active participants and leaders in the Python open-source community.

name: Rails Girls
description: Organization which aims to give tools and a community for women to understand technology and to build their ideas.

name: Rails Girls Summer of Code
description: Rails Girls Summer of Code is a global fellowship program aimed at bringing more diversity into Open Source.

name: R-Ladies
description: A worl-wide organization to promote gender diversity in the R community.

name: Scala Bridge
description: Building an inclusive Scala community with introductory programming workshops for women.

name: She++
description: Non-profit organization that works to empower underrepresented groups in technology by dismantling negative stereotypes surrounding technical careers.

name: Techtonica
description: Techtonica partners with tech companies to offer tech apprenticeships with stipends and job placement to Bay Area women and non-binary, feminine-adjacent adults with low incomes.

name: Teens Exploring Technology
description: Encourages inner city teenage Black and Latino males to become catalysts of change in urban communities.

name: TLA Women In Tech
description: Working group dedicated to increasing gender balance and equality in tech.

name: Trans*H4CK
description: Trans*H4CK empowers trans, gender non conforming, agender and nonbinary people through improving access to social services, promoting gender safety and community sustainability while bringing visibility to trans* tech innovators and entrepreneurs.

name: Women Techmakers
description: Google's program that provides visibility, community, and resources for women in technology.

name: Women Who Code
description: Women Who Code is a global community empowering women to excel in technology fields through resources, job boards, conference scholarships and other member benefits.

name: Women Who Tech
description: Nonprofit organization to bring together talented and renowned women breaking new ground in technology to transform the world and inspire change.

name: Wonder Women Tech
description: Organization that produces year-round programming and national and international conferences that highlight, educate, and celebrate women and diversity in STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, Math), innovation and entrepreneurialism.

name: YesWeTech
description: Feminist community working for an egalitarian and proud culture of women interested in technology.

name: AlterConf
description: AlterConf is a traveling conference series that provides safe opportunities for marginalized people and those who support them in the tech and gaming industries.

name: Elixir With Love
description: Elixir With Love is a proactive conference with the mission of introducing developers to this exciting new language and building a diverse Elixir community.

name: Lambda World
description: Lambda World is a functional programming conference with an ideology of empowering underrepresented minorities in tech. In this mindset, we have a few actions we follow such as creating grants to cover tickets and accommodation, hosting inclusive workshops, and making conferences more accessible to individuals finding it hard to be away from their families, by providing tourist activities, and necessities like cribs and strollers.
